result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew A Lemery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant must obtain his GED.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must undergo anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mathew A Lemery in court with attorney Julie Ann Lacost.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:30 pm. State have resolution - DRI count 1, plead to count 2 & 3 costs only on each count - w/held 12 months probation - AODA and follow thru (completed in March/15 assesstment thru Chips case) anger management assesstment and follow thru, have complied with victim notification, no restitution request - 75 hours co service - no contact has previously been waived by victim. State provided impact witness statement to court. Lacost agrees and 9 days credit (stipulated) Court DRI count 1. Defendant pleads NC to count 2 & 3 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds defendant entering plea, freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving right to JT, factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guility of counts 2 & 3 as alleged. State/Lacost follow recommendation apologizes to court on behalf of Lemery. Lemery apologizes. Court sentences to following after reviewing victim impact statement:

Count 2 -  w/hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year.  Conditions - costs, AODA and follow thru, anger mangement assesstment and follow thru, 75 hours co service, obtain GED, emp/school (verbage), no consumption/possession or entry - 9 days credit if revoked.

Count 3  - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year concurrent to count 2 - same conditions as count 2 with no additional community service. 

Appeal rights.

Defendant Mathew A Lemery in court with attorney Julie A. LaCost.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:49 pm. Lacost moves to sequestor. So ordered. 2:50 pm Officer Bath sworn and direct by state. Lacost objection (leading) sustained 2:54 pm. Lacost objection (leading) overruled 2:55 pm. Witness has identified the defendant 2:55 pm. State offers ex #1 (photos (6) of victim's face, neck injuries) court receives ex #1 (3:00 pm) after no objection from defense. Court questions officer on incident. Lacost cross 3:01 pm. State object (relevance) sustained 3:03 pm. State object (relevance) officer answered before court makes ruling - then court overruled. Witness excused 3:05 pm. TG (victim) sworn and direct by state 3:05 pm. Lacost object  - overruled 3:08 pm. Lacost objection overruled 3:09 pm. Lacost cross 3:11 pm. State objection (relevance) overruled 3:13 pm. State objection (relevance) overruled 3:13 pm. State objection (relevance) sustained 3:15 pm. State objection (relevance) sustained 3:15 pm. State objection (relevance) overruled 3:16 pm. State objection (relevance) sustained 3:16 pm. Court finds probable cause and binds over. State files INFO (mirror) bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 11:00 am. Lacost due to drive for defendant, asks to proceed to ARGN today, enters NG plea on all counts. Set for Final Pre-Trial, July 1, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant must notify attorney within 24 hours of new address and provide to DA and COC office, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with the victim (TG)

Defendant Mathew A Lemery in court with attorney Julie A. LaCost.  Defendant Mathew A Lemery in custody and appears via video.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:33 AM. LaCost received complaint in court and Lemery does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. LaCost and Lemery understand charges and penalties. LaCost waives further reading, requests PH within time limits and wants to address bond. LaCost - bond - informs Court that the alleged victim is also present in the Courtroom - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - believes some cash is necessary for stated reasons ($200.00 cash). Lacost is SPD appointed. Court - bond - $3000 signature bond - notify attorney within 24 hours of new address and provide to DA and COC office, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with the victim (TG). LaCost will waive time limits now. Court explains procedures to get the no contact provision lifted.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
